de.griefed.serverpackcreator.utilities.versionchecker

Class VersionChecker

  • java.lang.Object
    • de.griefed.serverpackcreator.utilities.versionchecker.VersionChecker
  • Direct Known Subclasses:
    GitHubChecker, GitLabChecker

    @Generated
public abstract class VersionChecker
extends java.lang.Object
    Baseclass from wich GitHub and GitLab checks extend. This class mainly provides the logic for comparing versions against each other to find out which is newer.

    • Method Detail

      • checkForUpdate

        public java.lang.String checkForUpdate(java.lang.String currentVersion,
                                       boolean checkForPreReleases)
        Check whether an update/newer version is available for the given version. If you want to check for PreReleases, too, then make sure to pass true for checkForPreReleases.
        Parameters:
        currentVersion - String. The current version of the app.
        checkForPreReleases - Boolean. false if you do not want to check for PreReleases. true if you want to check for PreReleases as well.
        Returns:
        String. Returns a concatenated String whether an update is available or not. Examples:
        No update available: No updates available.
        New release available: Current version: 2.0.0. A new release is available: 2.1.1. Download available at: https://github.com/Griefed/ServerPackCreator/releases/tag/2.1.1 New prerelease available: Current version: 2.0.0. A new PreRelease is available: 3.0.0-alpha.14. Download available at: https://github.com/Griefed/ServerPackCreator/releases/tag/3.0.0-alpha.14

      • allVersions

      • latestBeta

        protected java.lang.String latestBeta()
                               throws java.lang.NumberFormatException
        Get the latest beta release.
        Returns:
        String. Returns the latest beta release. If no beta release is available, no_betas is returned.
        Throws:
        java.lang.NumberFormatException - Thrown if a version can not be parsed into integers.

      • latestAlpha

        protected java.lang.String latestAlpha()
                                throws java.lang.NumberFormatException
        Get the latest alpha release.
        Returns:
        String. Returns the latest alpha release. If no alpha release is available, no_alphas is returned.
        Throws:
        java.lang.NumberFormatException - Thrown if a versions can not be parsed into integers.
